quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Richard Nixon and Things
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, genius, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which football coach said:  You carry on no matter what the obstacles are. You simply refuse to give up - and, when the going gets tough, you get tougher and you win.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vince Lombardi

questions.question: Richard Nixon served in the U.S. Army.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Richard Nixon was raised in which of the following religions?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Quaker

questions.question: Is this a Chinese proverb: If  we dont change the direction were going, were likely to end up where were headed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Richard Nixon was not the first U.S. President to resign from office.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The name of Richard Nixons famous dog was Checkers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What was the name of Richard Nixons wife?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pat

questions.question: Former president George H. W. Bush was a member of the Nixon administration.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Did basketball coach Bob Knight say: Learn to do things right and then do them right every time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: George Halas said that the things which hurt instruct.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What NBA coach stated that, You can only receive what you are willing to give?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pat Riley

questions.question: Which genius stated that, Insanity is doing the same thing over and over again and expecting a different result?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Albert Einstein

questions.question: Who said that, Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, ambition inspired, and success achieved.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Helen Keller

questions.question: Did Plato state that, The first and best victory is to conquer self?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Which NBA star made this statement: Sometimes a players greatest challenge is coming to grips with his/her role on the team.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scottie Pippen

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Nickname and Author
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, leader, freud. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The three DiMaggio brothers, who played major league baseball at the same time, were actually born with which of the following names?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guiseppe, Dominic, Vincent

questions.question: At 53, Muggsy Bogues was the smallest player in NBA history but he was big enough to outgrow his real given name, Moses.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Rather than be paraded through the streets of Rome, this queen chose to die from the bite of an asp.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cleopatra

questions.question: Name the cult leader of the Peoples Temple who was responsible for the suicide/murder of over 900 members of the Peoples Temple on November 18th 1978.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jim Jones

questions.question: I feel certain that I am going mad again. I feel we cant go through another of those terrible times. What British author, played by Nicole Kidman, in The Hours, filled her pockets with stones and walked into a river near her home?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Virgina Woolf

questions.question: What was the nickname of Byron White, the only professional football player ever appointed to the Supreme Court?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Whizzer

questions.question: This former German journalist helped Andreas Baader escape imprisonment and formed the Red Army Fraction. What German terrorist and author of The Concept of the Urban Guerrilla hanged herself on May 9, 1976?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ulrike Meinhof

questions.question: Is it true that Pancho Segura and Pancho Gonzalez, who were both kings on the tennis court,  were christened with the same first name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Sigmund Freud, the Father of Psychoanalysis, committed suicide on September 23, 1939.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The Alous, with four family members in the MLB, may lineup as baseballs most impressive brood, but only one Alou boasts even the hint of a nickname. What is it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Matty

questions.question: Knute is perhaps the most famous name in college football but it was not Coach Rocknes real first name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Hes not a Priest or Deacon, but in court, this Atlanta Falcons defensive veteran has a real first name he can swear to.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lawyer Milloy

questions.question: Duke, Dizzy, Peewee,  Satchel, Whitey, Yogi: all of these famous baseball handles were nicknames, except for one, which was a given first name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of the boxing champions below carried a name into the ring most different from his actual birth name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sugar Ray Robinson

questions.question: What was the real name of Connie Mack, the legendary manager of the Philadelphia As?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cornelius McGillicuddy

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Passengers and Engineer
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, bush, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The engineer of engine # 382 was trying to make up 95 minutes of lost time when he rounded an s-curve to find four cars of  a passenger train stalled on the track. Shouting at the fireman to jump, the engineer began to brake the train. What is the name of the engineer who rode engine # 382 to his death in order to save the passengers on the stalled train?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Casey Jones

questions.question: George W. Bush became the 42nd President of the United States.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Nicknamed The Splendid Splinter, this Hall of Fame baseball player interrupted his career twice to serve in World War II and the Korean War.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ted Williams

questions.question: James Buchanan was a Republican.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Lyndon B. Johnson, who served as vice-president under John F. Kennedy, was sworn into office the day after President Kennedy was shot.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This authors novel The Bell Jar was based on her own mental breakdown while a student at Smith. What author of Ariel and Winter Trees, killed herself by placing her head in a gas oven?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sylvia Plath

questions.question: On September 11, 2001 according to U.S. Today 3,949 planes were in the air space over the United States when, for the first time in United States history, all air traffic was stopped. Though often overlooked, air controllers brought the planes and passengers down safely to the nearest airport. How long did it take for the air controllers to get everyone safely on the ground?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: About three hours

questions.question: On September 11, 2001 Flight # 93 had forty crew members and passengers whose brave actions saved America from one more unspeakable terror on that day of horror. Lisa Jefferson, a customer representative, was on the telephone with one of the passengers and reported his comments as the passengers tried to take back the plane. Whose cry of Lets roll became a rallying cry for the nation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Todd Beamer

questions.question: On October 20, 1973 in an effort to keep the Watergate tapes from the office of Special Prosecutor, Archibald Cox, President Richard Nixon ordered his  Attorney General to fire Archibald Cox. What was the name of the Attorney General who resigned rather than break his word to congress that the White House would not interfere with the investigation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elliot Richardson

questions.question: I felt a determination cover my body like a quilt in winter , is how this lady described her feelings when she confronted bus driver James Blake. She was later called Mother of the Civil Rights Movement.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rosa Parks

questions.question: Razors pain you;
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dorothy Parker

questions.question: The 37th U.S. President, Richard Nixon was impeached due to the Watergate scandal.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of the following U.S. presidents was not assassinated while in office?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin D. Roosevelt

questions.question: Stepping in to head The Washington Post after the death of her husband, this lady took her fight to publish the Pentagon Papers all the way to the United States Supreme Court. But it was her backing of two unknown reporters, Carl Bernstein and Bob Woodward, that helped change the course of American history. Who was Attorney General John Mitchell referring to when he said to tell her she was gonna get her *** caught in a big fat wringer if thats published?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Katherine Graham

questions.question: Who was the 8th President of the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martin Van Buren

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Nicholas and Alexandra Fyodorovna
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, peak, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who portrayed Rocky Balboa in the Rocky films?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sylvester Stallone

questions.question: Empress Alexandra Fyodorovna was from which country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Germany

questions.question: Nicholas II actually became Tsar of Russia before he married Alexandra.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Both Nicholas II and Alexandra Fyodorovna were first cousins of King George V of England.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who was the first U.S. president to serve over 12 years?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin D. Roosevelt

questions.question: Alexandra Fyodorovnas sister was married to Nicholas IIs brother.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is the highest peak of the Rocky Mountains?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mount Elbert

questions.question: How many terms can a U.S. president serve?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2

questions.question: Who played Dr. Frank N. Furter in the comedy-horror musical film The Rocky Horror Picture Show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tim Curry

questions.question: When Nicholas abdicated the throne in 1917, he also abdicated for his heir, Alexis.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: How many children did Nicholas II and his wife Alexandra have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5

questions.question: Which of these U.S. presidents was in office less than 1 year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Henry Harrison

questions.question: Who was the father of Nicholas II of Russia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tsar Alexander III

questions.question: Who served as the 23rd President of the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benjamin Harrison

questions.question: What language did Nicholas II and Alexandra Fyodorovna use in private conversation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: English

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Rocky and Actor
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, citation, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What are Rocky Mountain oysters?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bull testicles

questions.question: One of the following statements concerning the life and personality of Sir Walter Scott is wrong.

options.text: All of these statements are actually true.
He was the first author to have a truly international career in his lifetime.
He is sometimes known as the Great Magician.
He was a prolific Scottish historical novelist and poet.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these statements are actually true.

questions.question: Rocky Johnson, a former Canadian professional wrestler, is the father of what actor and former wrestler?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Rock

questions.question: Just one of these could be the work of George Gilbert Scott.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Church

questions.question: Jason Scott Lee is an Asian American movie actor. He starred in all these movies except one.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ride the High Country

questions.question: Winfield Scott was a United States lieutenant general, diplomat, and presidential candidate. In the 1852 presidential election, Scott was the unsuccessful Whig Party candidate, losing to this Democrat.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin Pierce

questions.question: Rocky Top is the official song of what US state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tennessee

questions.question: This Rocky was killed in a plane crash on August 31, 1969.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rocky Marciano

questions.question: The following citation is taken from this novel of F. Scott Fitzgerald.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Great Gatsby

questions.question: Rocky Road ice cream is traditionally composed of chocolate ice cream, nuts and what else?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marshmallows

questions.question: This comedienne, named Tracey, hosted a weekly television variety show  which ended with the catchphrase Go Home.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tracey Ullman

questions.question: Which Rocky was a former fullback for the Pittsburgh Steelers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rocky Bleier

questions.question: This actress, known for her performance in the TV series The Avengers, portrayed Tracy Bond in Her Majestys Secret Service.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Diana Rigg

questions.question: Francis Scott Key was an American lawyer and amateur poet. One of his poems was added to already existing music, and the combination was adopted as the American national anthem in 1931. This is the name of the above-mentioned poem.

options.text: His poem did not have a name.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Defence of Fort MHenry

questions.question: This Tracy, who won two Academy Awards, portrayed Captain Culpepper, Henry Drummond, Richard Sumner and Stanley Banks.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spencer Tracy
